website_summaries.verdict: A good handheld pool vacuum option if you want something small for spot cleanups.
pros: Narrow profile of the vacuum uses an ergonomic handle for a comfortable grip while using it
Vacuum has enough power to remove larger debris from the pool without struggling
cons: Best used for small areas around the pool
Has a hard time with major use or cleanup projects

customer_reviews.title: Works Great but has Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. Worked great in the beginning - picked up sand, gunk, small leaves, etc. I have a small (7' X 10') spa. BUT after turning the unit off and on a few times I broke it! The fatal flaw is that there is no switch in the conventional sense. You twist it on and off. But, If you turn it too far, you will split it open. I tried to epoxy it together with out any luck. Good news. I called the manufacturer about it and they sent me a new one, postage paid. I am keeping the 2 "O" rings well lubricated.
customer_reviews.author: Gmaz

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this
customer_reviews.text: Initial review is that I’ve needed this for a long time. Simple to assemble. I used it for 5 minutes and could see it picking up debris on the bottom of my little bubble tub. I’m happy. P.S. a few weeks later. Tried the micro filter today. Unbelievable! It picked up debris I couldn’t see. Mainly dirt particles that cannot be seen. Incredible!
customer_reviews.author: R0bertG

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: When it works it did a okay job. A little tideous to empty it. Mine cracked in the battery compartment and flooded and destroyed it only lasting one season. I have contacted the company for warranty and will keep this post updated
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s Pool vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed that it doesn’t come with a pole. It would have been fine if it fit my skimmer pole, but it doesn’t. Now we either get in the pool and hunch over to vacuum or buy another pole. Also, it takes 5 D batteries, and I anticipate having to change them often. 3 hours doesn’t feel like a lot of run time. That remains to be seen. This device does a good job, and comes highly rated from a friend, but it’s a very slow process. The suction path is only a couple of inches wide, and I have a 22 ft round pool.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-O

customer_reviews.title: Easy everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about this device. How could it have enough suction to clean a pool with just batteries? Pleasantly surprised! Had some mess on the bottom of the pool we just couldn’t get out. I just used it for the first time and it’s clean! The biggest plus is that it doesn’t go through the filter so no loss of water when back washing. This is essential for us because we are on a well and have limited water resources. The only drawback I’ve seen so far is the filter on s small so needs cleaning frequently. But, I did have a bit to f bottom litter to remove. Well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Grovia Springham

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Made my life so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: *ETA: had it a little while now. It’s still awesome. The regular old Duracells I started out with are still going. Love this vacuum! So easy. It was just delivered today so I can’t say anything about longevity, but it sucked up everything and was so easy to use! I have a 12’ x 24’ above ground pool with a skimmer that hangs on the wall. The vacuum that attaches to that would pull off the skimmer and it was a huge pain. I had to empty this one three times but it was awesome to be cordless and it did an amazing job sucking up even sand with the regular filter. Beyond impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Keeps pool very clean
customer_reviews.text: This tool was easy to set up and use. Uses 5 D cell flashlight batteries. It turned cleaning the pool from a two man job, to a one man job. The broom has a fine mesh sock, so it picks up all the fine particulate matter on the bottom. My big vacuum would just hit it and disperse it again. The water has been kept much cleaner and I have saved water and chemicals by not having to use my big vacuum with the pump. Would recommend this to any pool owner!
customer_reviews.author: Marc  A. Luker

customer_reviews.title: Particles/trash coughs out
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in a inside Spanish fountain with 3 tiers above the ground level. The base layer depth is 12 inches deep I was disappointed in the suction power as the vacuum had,and had to be right on top of the particle. It is possible the batteries which I bought new were depleted, thus poor suction. The impellers tended to push particles away - leaving me chasing around the pieces to vacuum up. Upon turning it off - the particles (not all of them) but a great amount were released back into the water. Disappointing !
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wooster

customer_reviews.title: Works well to vacuum debris but needs a readily available extension handle.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use in kiddie pool. Battery powered. Works well to remove sand and debris off bottom of pool. Sucks up debris into a reusable filter bag. Easy to remove and change out. Short handle. Wish I could buy a short pool handle that fits this vacuum head. Tried one but too long. Made vacuum very heavy to handle. It requires the head of vacuum to be twisted in order to disengage the batteries. I would prefer a separate switch. Awkward to handle. Makes it a clumsy piece. However, the suction is good for a battery operated vacuum and I like the filters. Came with two replacement filters.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma29

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small particles
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. We have some heavy winds and inevitably small particles of dirt get into my spa. This comes with two small filter bags that captures them like no other product I own. I took to constantly swirling the water around so they could just go into the filter, but that took days. My one complaint is when I am done, most likely my hands are wet and I can not get a good grip on it to turn it off. I have to sort of stabilize the whole thing on the ground, which does turn it off but makes the head of the vacuum come off. It's really not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: DianneO

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This works great; however, you have to put a lot of clear sealer on the black o-rings to prevent water from getting into the battery compartment. Each time to you stop using it, you need to take it apart, dray the batteries off and clean the battery connectors so they don't get corroded. I had very fine sand in my pool and jucuzzi and the Pool Blaster gets every little piece. It easily attaches to any pool pole and turns on which a small twist. Easily moves around the pool and hot tub picking up bugs, sand, leaves, etc. A great item, I'm glad I spent the money...
customer_reviews.author: Allan T. Cordera

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a new & received a used product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased hundreds of items from Amazon. For the most part, always fairly satisfied, however NEVER have I bought a “new” product & sent a used one before. The very least they could have done before sending it to me was clean out the bugs out of the filter & hair out of the battery area. I was wondering why the box was so tightly taped close. Also the paperwork smells like cigarette smoke. Not a happy consumer!
customer_reviews.author: Leiann Shephard

customer_reviews.title: Fun tool!!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t come with pole, I hate when pictures advertise parts you have to buy separately but have to read all fine print to discover that. Works great for what we need it for, was very excited for this delivery to come, and it didn’t disappoint! Also comes with extra filter, bonus!!! Love that it’s cordless, plan to remove batteries at the end of summer each year to reduce chances of corrosion
customer_reviews.author: Amellia Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum. Perfect for small pools
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum and read the reviews later. I almost returned it without opening it based on the reviews. Glad I didn’t it works great for my 10’ intex it’s just perfect for it. I love the vacuum. It is not hard to turn on and I have arthritis. It doesn’t come with a pole but honestly the 10’ is shallow I don’t need it but I will get one for it so I can reach the center without falling in :)
customer_reviews.author: katrina Duell

customer_reviews.title: 99c store Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is way under powered, it takes forever to vacuum just a small sq ft area. respect your money and do not buy this. your pool water filter sucks way more, i plan to just make a flexible hose extension from the pool filter inlet to use as a vaccume, because this is just a huge waste of money. and if you do buy it regardless of this review, i hope you have a lot of time, batteries, and patience just to clean a kid size pool.
customer_reviews.author: Ftg

customer_reviews.title: No long handle
customer_reviews.text: No problem with Amazon, but we have bought similar product in past years at Kmart and Wal-Mart for $20. No local stores carry product any longer. Ordered online and only comes with the vacuum piece and about a foot of a handle attached. Hard to use in a pool that is 3ft deep. Have to bend over and crouch kills your back, and...it was over $50. Would not order it again unless a longer handle came with like the other ones in the past.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Very good and price is very good!
customer_reviews.text: Well my wife wanted this for the spa for the small dirt in the bottom of the spa. Once she used it in the spa she started using it in the pool on the corners that the pool main sweep could not get. She loves the broom and said it’s easy to use. It could be stronger in my opinion but it uses batteries so was not expecting much. The only complaint is that it goes through batteries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: I RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This spa vacuum is so awesome and easy to use and really has good suction for my Intex inflatable hot tub. You’re be surprised how much stuff you suck up in the filter. Speaking of the filter It’s easy to clean! Only negative thing I have to say is that it’s kinda hard to turn on and off but If you use a little force it turns on and off fine. Don’t waste your money on that stupid non battery natural vacuum stick that amazon also sells, I bought that one before it barley works! On the other hand this vacuum Really WORKS! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: arley nieto

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam!!! I paid a ton of money for this!!! When I received it, there was no a pole with the vacuum. I called the manufacturer and they said the pole is not included. It also states that in the description on Amazon. I didn’t read that far because common sense tells you that if you pay $80 for a spa vacuum, it would come with a pole. The only way I would be able to use this is if I were under water while I’m vacuuming. DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Once i got my spa up. Bought this before my spa was ready to have in place any only used a few times and then quit working So disappointed. To late to return now
customer_reviews.author: tvhop

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality- Low Suction
customer_reviews.text: The product is cheaply made and the basket falls out regularly while cleaning. There is very little suction power and the one/off mechanism is very difficult to operate. You need to twist the head of the broom in order to turn it on and off, and it does not move easily. I immediately contacted the seller asking to return the item, but they DO NOT ACCEPT RETURNS ONCE THE ITEM HAS BEEN USED! How is a buyer supposed to know the item doesn't perform as advertised if you don't use it?!? I'm very disappointed, and feel ripped off. I would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: gioia schultz

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product.
customer_reviews.text: OK folks. This thing is awesome. Kids went in the hot tub and left piles of sand. Drained it and tried to get the sand out with a cloth paper towel. Looked OK but after it settled the sand was back. Watch a few reviews on you tube and bought it. Tried it today. Put the fine filter sock type filter over the net in the pickup area. Vacuumed it and I couldn't believe how fast is was. Then I took the sock out to empty the filter. Some sand but not much. Then I looked in the pick up head and there were piles of sand. Unbelievable. Buy it you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Impala 66

customer_reviews.title: Buy Batteries.  Don't expect great results.
customer_reviews.text: It takes 5 D size batteries. Be sure to have those. It sucks up sand and debris but not smaller particles. Most particles on the floor of pools are fine particles which this will suck up and spit out again. It looks like it cleans but it doesn't really. You have to move it very slowly through the water to be effective. It needs a more fine mesh net in the canister. Will try some cheese-clothe and see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gebhardt

customer_reviews.title: You Will Need An Extension Pole That Fits It
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and has fairly good suction. Big negative that it doesn't come with an extension pole or that the handle isn't longer. Neither of the pool poles I have work with it. I also wish the vacuum was a little wider. Next time I will pay a little more and buy a pool vacuum that has everything I need to do the job. I didn't mind purchasing the batteries separate, but not having an extension handle to fit it sure is an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Mary ONeal

customer_reviews.title: Picture miss leading
customer_reviews.text: This works good but should have came with a longer pole. Obviously I missed the part where it said it didn't come with the long pole. Hurts your back to be leaning over. So when you buy it make sure you read the description. And buy pole to attach to it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16 x 50 in ground pool. I wanted the aqua broom to quickly touch up spots (not the whole pool), such as dead worms, bugs, etc., without bringing out and connecting my huge vacuum hose system. This worked great. In 10 minutes I was done. I did not use the fine filter bag since I only wanted to remove larger visible objects. The suction was good enough to remove all the debris described.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money! Dont purchase.
customer_reviews.text: don't purchase! it did not come with a pole! it would vacuum stuff on the bottom of the pool, but the suction would stop after a short time and the screen would have to be cleaned. it takes to many batteries. you have to use 5 D size batteries and they don't last that long. you have to twist it to turn it on and off. which is the same way you un screw it to replace the batteries. despite 3 rubber seals water gets into the battery compartment and causes corrosion. now the unit I purchased has stopped working because of the water in the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W Young

customer_reviews.title: It does the job and you cannot beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, works great in my 16' dia. above ground pool. Takes 5 D batteries for about 3 hours continuous use. Only downside, is that it came with the wrong size filters for this product, but not a big deal since the filter will probably outlast the unit itself. You cannot beat the price - for the cost of two pizza's, I'm happy with the quality and utility this little vacuum provides.
customer_reviews.author: Frankenformer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after the first use. We put new batteries in but my hubby confirmed the motor was seized. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gruenke

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and it works great. I love not having to drag out the hose for my other vacuum. In fact, I have not used my hose vacuum since buying this. (I have a 15 ft above ground Intext pool) This year I broke the plastic piece around the on/ off switch and I thought I would have to replace it. With a little redneck engineering, I was able to fix it and it still works great. This does a great job picking up the small particles on the pool floor. If I broke it again and coulnd't fix it, I would definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: dlindsay32

customer_reviews.title: Great for small pools
customer_reviews.text: I actually waited to buy this because I thought it cost too much. I got lucky and scored it for $35. Honestly, it's worth the full price. I had an uncovered best way pool (13' x 7') that was so dirty. We need to drain it to level it better. I skimmed it,but the stuff on the floor just didn't seem to come up. I used this for 20inuted.and had. A whole new clear clean pool! I love it. I follow the other reviews and take the batteries out after using so no corrosion.
customer_reviews.author: Hulagirl08

customer_reviews.title: My "go to" tool for algae
customer_reviews.text: Works very well--better than my robotic cleaner--for algae, provided that you basically keep up with your pool. The algae filter was included in the price of the Aqua Broom. It's not for heavy accumulations. Seems to work best if you sweep the bottom with a conventional broom in one arm and the Aqua Broom in the other, creating a little cloud of particles instead of a flat layer on the bottom of the pool. Very cost-effective tool!
customer_reviews.author: L. Speakes

customer_reviews.title: Love this vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Recently bought an above ground 10' pool, not huge, but does the job. Bought one of those pool vacuums that use the hose with, which totally did not work for me. My issue if the fine sediment that gets on the floor of the pool, not the leaves, and that vacuum just spread the dirt around. Bought this vacuum even though hearing some negativity about the batteries. It did a great job sweeping up the sediment and had no issues with the batteries. Ran it for about twenty minutes and could have ran it longer, if needed. Really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Caution on use.
customer_reviews.text: Just tried to start my broom after leaving it in a closet for the winter. The motor has rusted out along with the contacts. I used it about 5 times last summer and dried it on my screened-in back porch after each use then put it away for the winter. It worked well last summer but obviously if any water remains in the motor area it is no good. Called the company and was told it is a year warranty which I guess is as long as it may last. Would recommend another broom or a real thorough drying after use.
customer_reviews.author: TDigs

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this! Our pool gets mucked up with pine ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this! Our pool gets mucked up with pine and fir needles and cottonwood fluff. This was the perfect solution to getting all of the stuff off of the bottom of the pool. I read where there was trouble with battery corrosion, so each time I use it I open up the battery compartment and let it sit for a few hours. It has never had any moisture inside. I am very happy with how this works! It doesn't come with an extension handle and I didn't see where to purchase one, but my husband rigged up a shop broom handle to it and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: N.L.

customer_reviews.title: They are really handy but why the manufacturer cannot find a better strength plastic that holds up is beyond me
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these and both have broken (snapped in the middle) after a single use. They are really handy but why the manufacturer cannot find a better strength plastic that holds up is beyond me. Or make if from aluminum. I'll happily pay twice as much if it never breaks again. Sorry not going to buy a third one. Too expensive for a single use product.
customer_reviews.author: Bayshore

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for $50 and I am so glad I did! It works great on my 8' round pool. I bought rechargeable batteries for it, but the first set of regular D's that I put in didn't wear out for several uses.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha McManus

customer_reviews.title: On/Off poor design
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great and the broom works like it is supposed to however, it is very difficult to turn off and on. The on/off switch works by turning the entire bottom of the broom to either on or off. The instructions say it must be turned off/on immediately when taking it out of the pool or putting it in the pool to avoid damage to motor and batteries. On a twelve ft extension it is difficult to perform either of these actions especially if the broom is wet and slippery. Why couldn't you just put a switch on it? Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: 386 Senior

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces and kiddie pools
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so it takes five "D" batteries, but so far it has lasted all summer. Picks up all the crud from the bottom of my Intex family pool (blow up). Not hard to get together if you pay attention to the directions. I would recommend this for anyone trying to keep a baby / inflatable pool usable. Anything much bigger i.e. (Spa / Hot tub) will wear you out. The suction is not hard enough to clean quickly. For my purpose it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Larrisa L. Malott

customer_reviews.title: this works for little tidy ups
customer_reviews.text: this is great for daily picking up of the odd leaf or dead bug at the bottom. or grass clippings if you get in and out a lot after mowing. small things like sand go right through the mesh... overall this makes 2 minutes of daily maintenance a lot LOT easier than trying to hook up the big vaccuum
customer_reviews.author: Timmerz

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to operate
customer_reviews.text: It is very hard to turn the head of the vacuum to turn it on and off. It is too difficult for small hands. (It really needs a switch). It doesn't glide along the bottom easily. Works best if held vertical with no slant, making it very difficult to reach the center of pool/spa. I didn't feel it picked up sand very well, but it did get other small particles. Having to take it apart and remove batteries each time to let it dry is not a convenience feature.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Whaley

customer_reviews.title: I wish I knew of another product to recommend,
customer_reviews.text: I got it to clean a fountain of debris that settles to the bottom. The debris is bigger than sand, but still light duty cleaning. The aqua broom just isn’t powerful enough to clean anything much more than a small batch of sand. Using it do any more than a couple of minutes and it starts to lose power. If you’re concerned it won’t be powerful enough for what you need than it isn’t. I wish I knew of another product to recommend,
customer_reviews.author: Peffinger

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought this 16 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: This Aqua Broom is exactly what I needed! Since receiving this, I haven't had to use my pool vaccuum 1 time - no need! Great suction, connects to pole for long range, or use while walking around in the pool, which is what I usually do. Some have said batteries don't last, I put 4 Ray O Vac batteries when I got it in June and they are still working! Just bought another set to finish out the summer! Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: John Severino

customer_reviews.title: Cannot suck filter sand. Just disperses.
customer_reviews.text: I used new batteries. This is just a toy. No use for any big sized pool. I hoped I can quickly pick some sand in corners and folds. Don't even think of picking a leaf on pool floor. Basically, this product has poor suction power, merely disperses the sand to give you a feeling that it cleaned. You'll anyway need to use a pool robot later when sand settles down.
customer_reviews.author: rippedoff

customer_reviews.title: Great tub vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for picking up dirt and debris that occasionally gets into our hot tub. It can be a bit awkward to turn on/off, because you have to make a big turn with the head of the unit. A switch would be better. Besides that, really great vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bykin

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one month before completely died. Doesn't work with new batteries. POS, don't waste money.
customer_reviews.author: Gagemu

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little vac for my inground pool.
customer_reviews.text: Makes small cleanup jobs of woodchips and dirt that collect in the corners a breeze. I save a lot of time not getting the robot cleaner out for the small occasional cleanings. You do have to be careful not to tip it upside down, and leave it on until it is out of the water otherwise some of the dirt collected can drop back into the pool. It's cheap, quick, and easy... even if it only lasts one season I consider it money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: It didn't pick up the calcium deposits I bought it for. They're still pooling in the hot tub seats. It's ok if there's bigger stuff... Which I don't really have. Better than having nothing on hand. But I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Has kept our pool clean all summer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean our Intex Ultraframe. My biggest concern was that it would chew through batteries. However, it's August and I'm still on the original set of batteries - 3 months on one set is good battery life in my opinion! As other reviewers said, it is a little difficult to turn off and on, but not THAT hard, you just have to put some muscle into it sometimes. It does a decent job cleaning. Sometimes it just stirs up what you're trying to sweep up, but it did get up most of the sand we accidentally got in the bottom of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Needs to come with an extended handle
customer_reviews.text: Does an okay job for what you pay. Can't find a handle though, though - otherwise I'd give it 5 stars. It really sucks to have to climb in the pool and hunch over to vacuum it out. When the chemicals aren't lined up right or when there is algea that needs to be vacuumed out, having to get in the pool to vacuum poses a problem...
customer_reviews.author: waterfalls26

customer_reviews.title: LOW Suction
customer_reviews.text: This worked for me ONE time, and then stopped. This was on a brand new set of batteries. I should also mentioned that I had to stop and restart it about five times during the cleaning process because it kept losing suction. This is going back!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Awful product
customer_reviews.text: This was an awful product. Suction is barely enough to suck up leaves. Clogs up easily and often. My DE filter powder was blown into the pool and it would just suck it in and blow it back out of its housing. Wouldn’t clean it up which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn, TX

customer_reviews.title: item did not work
customer_reviews.text: I tried the water broom and it did not work; so I tried newer batteries and it still did not work. I would appreciate my refund. I returned the product and it has had time to reach you. Please refund my money.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not durable
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have mentioned, the problem with this product is its durability. It works reasonably well for about one year, then the motor dies. On the other hand, it’s hard to find an equivalent product — a portable, handheld, powered vacuum for small water features. So I ended up replacing my dead one with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It works very well as described. The only complaint and reason for 4 stars is that the debris net/bag can be difficult to clean and it likes to eat batteries. Other wise it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Petras

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works! Wasn’t sure how well it was going to clean my smaller above ground pool but it did great. Hoping it will last multiple seasons. So far, I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Work great!!
customer_reviews.text: So far this little vacuum works great. Been using it for a month now and it picks up all the stuff on the bottom of my pool. The only thing I don't like about it is the need for D size batteries that cost a lot . I've tried 2 other vacuums that didn't have as much suction power and wouldn't pick up all of the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Baldy

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum does a nice job
customer_reviews.text: great way to clean the bottom of your hot tub or spa. One major recommendation is before you use this product put some silicon grease on the o-ring. If you don't do this once a month it becomes very hard to turn on and off. With the o-ring greased it works as designed and does a nice job. I suspect many people have broken the handle trying to turn it off if they did not grease the o-ring.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: Shop around before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: The pool vacuum worked great for two months. Then bam. Nothing. Changed batteries. No use. Not sure what happen. Used maybe twice a week for 2 months. Batteries came out looking strange.
customer_reviews.author: Julie siordia

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10ft x 30 in round pool in a rural area so we have a little sand every day. Used with the added filters included we can pick up it all up in under 10 minutes. We have used our cleaner for 10 straight days and the battery power and suction is still going strong. Its not a Kirby so be patient and you will be happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Aqua Broom Meeting expectations for above ground 15ft pool
customer_reviews.text: The aqua broom worked wonderfully on my above ground pool. If you go slowly it will remove the dirt and small amount of leaves of the bottom of the pool. I would recommend this product and purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharii Olowu-Wright

customer_reviews.title: On switch is difficult.  Suggest a head adaptor.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in a small plastic pond with bumps in the bottom. It would be nice to have a small head extension to get into the nooks n crannies. I understand the on-off has to be water tight, but twisting the whole head as a switch is hard, especially if you have arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Trig Simon

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: 08-22-2014: IT WORKED WONDERFUL BUT THE BAG HOLDER BARELY CLIPS AND IS VERY CHEAPLY MADE. I ONLY HOPE IT WILL HOLD UP. 06-05-2016: Well it lasted 1 1/2 years and broke in the part that I was worried about. The sad part is I used it less that 5 times because I have a Polaris 360 and it cleans the pool very well. The weakness in the Pool Broom is the connection between the battery pole and the sweeper head. It is just to thin and too cheaply made. It barely fits together and breaks easily. The reviews are right (when it works it is great but when it breaks it is a very expensive toy).
customer_reviews.author: M. B.

customer_reviews.title: seems ok so far
customer_reviews.text: Works okay in our hot tub I was disappointed that it didn't come with a longer Pole definitely have to go over multiple times to get it to suck up hoping the batteries don't get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian young

customer_reviews.title: Made for a children's pool not for a over ground pool
customer_reviews.text: First of all this does not come with the pole or an extension second this item is made for like a kid pool not an above-the-ground pool the video that it showed is nothing to what it actually functions like and the little compartment that fills up with you have to rinse it every minute or the suction stops working so it was pretty useless for me and I would say for a pretty clean pool that just wanted to suck up basic degree on the bottom this did not work Please be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE...other reviews have said that the product is difficult to turn off/on. I disagree. Being an 'antique girl' I was nervous about it, but the company must have read those reviews: the broom turns easily and smoothly. I am quite relieved. I gave only four stars because while I got up several baby oranges, the silt is very difficult to trap, even with the additional sand and silt bag. However, all in all, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MERITAGE

customer_reviews.title: It's a vacuum cleaner for water.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a vacuum for our backyard fish pond. Most of the ones I found only work in deep water. This one works in our foot deep pond. And it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron K

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I used it twice. So far it’s been good. I’m taking the batteries out between uses because of previous reviews. It works for our little cheap pool, gets the dirt off the bottom that our little filter can’t get.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy b.

customer_reviews.title: It's Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a small bladder pool that is 12 feet in diameter and almost 3 feet deep. It works perfectly for it. It's easy to use and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Our neighbors tree drops leaves and other debris into our spa. This vacuum does a great job cleaning all the dirt and pollen and seeds easy to use. I did follow others advice and get rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small pond and it didn't pick up anything - leaves or dirt. I watched the video and read the other reviews and I don't see that I am doing anything wrong. If I don't get helpful suggestions then I will have to return it
customer_reviews.author: SKK

customer_reviews.title: "Not really a "Blaster."
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much as advertised. Not exactly a Dyson, or a Dirt Devil for that matter. To be fair though it is a D-cell powered broom and it does pick up the thin layer of sand and little debris in my small pond. The handbook sucks though. Doesn't tell you how to remove the filter for screening and other little things like that, but they do include a handbook for more products to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Info

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It has a lot of suction and pulls up leaves and fine particles in the pool. Nice that you do not need to hook to garden hose like the old ones, and only takes batteries. I would buy over and over again and does an excellent job vacuuming. Just wished it came with a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Debra S. Hermsen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far. Gets the crud off the bottom of my metal frame pool and hot tub, however.. it doesn't do well with smaller particulates, but I wasn't really expecting it too. Only downside is that it runs on batteries, but they also help add weight, so it kind of evens out
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked for ONLY 2 Months!
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed that this item was a "steal", taking into consideration the price and how well it worked on arrival. Unfortunately, after only 2 months' use, it stopped working. We were careful to follow all operating and maintenance instructions so we are not sure what happened. It appeared to be running, but it was no longer picking up anything at all in the pool. When it stopped working, we gave it a thorough cleaning and brand new batteries etc., to no avail. Maybe we got a lemon, but our experience with this product was not satisfactory in the least.
customer_reviews.author: SkinnyDiva

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived with one flap of it torn off then the remaining flaps taped. Also, the item appeared to have been used although I purchased a “new” one as the filter was already attached to the broom. In addition, the box didn’t include an owners manual or warranty card. VERY disappointed in this company! I don’t recommend that you purchase from this company! I kept the product despite this as it did work but due to the “bait and switch” tactics of this company and no warranty card, I will most likely be buying another one soon. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: No extension pole with this unit.  Won't fit standard extentions.
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit my standard extension pole. I had to modify a different one. I wish it came with an extension. It does a good job picking up dirt. Pretty heavy with 5 batteries. Hard to turn off and on. I am not sure I will keep it. I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bunting

customer_reviews.title: My only gripe is that depending on how dirty your pool is and how small the debris is
customer_reviews.text: Works surprisingly well to get silt/small debris from the bottom of my above ground pool. My only gripe is that depending on how dirty your pool is and how small the debris is, you seem to have to empty the bag every 5 minutes. Silt will coat the whole bag pretty quickly and stop the suction. Tip: do not turn the vaccum off while still in the water; it will cause the debris to come out of the bag and back into the pool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Floody

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for plug and fill Coleman spa. Works fantastic! Took another refieres suggesting and bought strong rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: noel anschutz

customer_reviews.title: this is fantastic, I have a big swimming pool with the ...
customer_reviews.text: this is fantastic, I have a big swimming pool with the new "clean system", however there are some spots where debris, usually sand accumulates (we are next to a lake), the aqua broom cleans it super easy, I highly recommend it. I usually like 2 times a week and batteries last really long, great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: My husband really liked this little vacuum. He was very diligent to dry it off each time he used it. We read the reviews and decided if we were careful with it , that it might work well. It worked well, but only 3 times. The forth time it wouldn't go on. When we looked further, there seemd to be water getting into the moter, somehow. It was very disappointing and we were 3 days past the return date. We've had it for a month. Kind of expensive for 3 uses. We are going to contact the company, however if it's not made well, the next one will probably last no longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Binkie

customer_reviews.title: Must have for spa and hot tub maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and an absolute necessity for any spa/hot tub. We had a very similar Aqua broom that broke after a few years hard use- we always used a knee-high stocking in the "filter" to assist in collecting the finer/sand particles- to our surprise, this broom HAS the stocking included!
customer_reviews.author: Ithmy

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Cleans my 18ft pool 3 times so fàr on the same batteries with no loss of power. Worth the money. The off on is a bit cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Mema

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. You will need a long pole though. (that's what she said)
customer_reviews.author: Donna Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price and a small area
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok, not great but good for the price point. Worked ok in my 10x10 pool. Would only use for small areas. Product arrived On time from seller.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Horrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Smaller Pools!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Intex 5000 gallon pool. Easy to put together (the extended handle is stored inside the wider handle for shipping; at first I thought they forgot to package it) 5 D cell batteries have lasted through 3 sweepings so far, about a half hour each. Easy to clean and really does a nice job getting the dead bugs, dirt and small debris off the bottom of the pool. I used my skimmer handle to make it longer. Easy to operate, the it is tricky to turn it off when done because the unit is wet and slippery. Perfect addition to small pool maintenance routine.
customer_reviews.author: Ohhorses

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all, motor goes on but no suction. Totally inefficient.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! Does not work at all. Does not come with the extension either so you must buy it separately which is just ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: suzmal

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It's a piece of junk. Also gotta buy a longer handle. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Tex morgan

customer_reviews.title: Aqua broom
customer_reviews.text: Replaced one I had for 3 years. They have not made them any better but no not worse! Needs more power and bigger debris filter!
customer_reviews.author: RP49

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Has worked entire season. Have 18ft round pool. Takes over an hour to vacuum as very small. Wish larger versions available
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't make it through our pool season!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this vac at the end of June and it stopped working days after the 90 day warranty. We're now at the end of our pool season and I'll have to come up with some way to clean up the bottom of the pool before we drain it. While it was working the vac did a fair job but you had to clean out the small basket frequently. We only have a 9x16 Intex pool so this vac was ok for the size of our pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work very well for our spa. It makes picking up grit easy. Ours fell over and cracked the ring around the vac housing. That let water get past the seals and get into the motor, and that killed it. I'd like to see a better design, although I will order another one. Batteries last a whole season.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Miles

customer_reviews.title: This was a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money .. Not much suction, you had to go veeeeerrrryyy slow with it, and basically it just stirred up the sediment, etc .. didn't do much as far as vacuuming. A MAJOR disappointment. I ended up buying a vacuum for half the price that attaches to your hose ande creates suction, and that worked much better . ( Still not ideal, though ) . I'm using it on a 16 ft + 48 inch Intex above ground pool.
customer_reviews.author: Ariane B.

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works, gets water in battery compartment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in May 2016 for light cleaning and it worked great for about 5 uses. Exchanged for another one, now this one has only worked a handful of times and no longer works. Both got water in battery compartment and rusted unfortunately I'm now past the 30 days and not sure what they would be willing to do. Once your 30day period is up there is no option to contact anyone. If anyone for the company or Amazon sees this please contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: Love it and hate it
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum, it works great on my swim spa. I HATE that it breaks so easy though. I bought 2 of these this summer and the case cracked in the exact same spot on both. I blamed my daughter the first time, didn't let her touch the 2nd one and same thing happened. When it cracks, water enters the battery compartment and it no longer works. It worked great to pick up even sand with the provided filter. Easy to use picked up leaves and everything I needed it to pick up. Trying to find one that works this well, but stands up to normal use better.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I buy this item. It is good for sand, small leaves and rocks. I have an in ground pool and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Good for small pools
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good suction. The only complaint I have with it is how quickly the filter inside fills up. However, it is easy to empty and continue using.
customer_reviews.author: Dara Brown

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! Until it doesn't...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. It works great on our vinyl pool. One negative is that it's pretty hard to turn it off and not have the head of the unit come right off. Kind of a stupid design. The other is that you have to clean it out constantly or else it stops working well. But honestly, for the price, it's pretty good. UPDATE**** After using it about 5 or 6 times, the housing cracked and now the thing won't turn on. If it were $20, fine. But for almost $60, no bueno.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Small but good
customer_reviews.text: It works .. its jus small . If you have a small pool its great .. I have a big one so its good .. I would have bought the bigger one had I known .
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Not for pools but a small spa would be ok.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum reminds me of a toy you give a child at Christmas time. It can work on a small scale for a small child but this is not for cleaning a proper pool. The first clue is where they tell you not to use this for opening of your pool. This is a nice concept but it's not for someone who wants to keep a pool clean. Perhaps you could use this for a small spa.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: Water Tech Pool Blaster Aqua Broom, Battery-Powered, Cordless Pool Cleaner, Spa Vacuum and Hot Tub Cleaner for In-ground, Above Ground and Soft-Sided Pools
product_meta.description: The Pool Blaster Aqua Broom, is one of the most affordable battery-powered pool and spa vacuums ever made! More powerful than any wand-type cleaners, this product comes with a reusable All-Purpose filter bag as well as (2) disposable microfilter bags for extra fine cleaning. Completely cordless, you can even attach this product to any standard-sized pool pole for extended reach cleaning!
feature_bullets: DEEP CLEANING: The Aqua Broom offers a more intense particulate cleaning of Sand & Silt than most vacuums for the Hot Tubs, Pools or Spas.
RUN TIME: The Aqua Broom is designed to run up to 3 hours and is powered by Five D-cell batteries.

EASY OPERATION: Simply twist the switch ON to operate. No forced-air operation, pumping or water hook-up required. Lightweight and easy to use by hand or attach to any standard telescopic pool pole. Weighs less than 2 lbs.(no pole included)
TRAPS DIRT: The Pool Blaster Aqua Broom traps dirt better than other vacuums. Our patented Retention Valve design stops the return of debris into the spa.
WHATS INCLUDED: (1) All-Purpose Filter Bag, (2) Disposable Micro-Filter Bags, (1) pole adapter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,154 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
